chop.label: Chop
chop.definition: Cut ingredients into rough, similarly sized pieces using a knife.
chop.tips: Keep your knife sharp and guide the blade with curled fingertips for safety.

dice.label: Dice
dice.definition: Cut ingredients into uniform cubes, typically small or medium in size.
dice.tips: Square off the ingredient before slicing into planks, sticks, then cubes for consistency.

mince.label: Mince
mince.definition: Cut ingredients into very fine pieces for even distribution.
mince.tips: Rock the knife tip while lifting the heel for fast mincing without bruising herbs.

julienne.label: Julienne
julienne.definition: Slice ingredients into thin matchstick-like strips.
julienne.tips: Stack uniform planks before slicing to keep sticks even in thickness.

chiffonade.label: Chiffonade
chiffonade.definition: Stack leafy greens, roll tightly, and slice into fine ribbons.
chiffonade.tips: Use a gentle sawing motion to avoid bruising delicate herbs like basil.

saute.label: Sauté
saute.definition: Cook quickly in a small amount of fat over medium-high heat while tossing.
saute.tips: Preheat the pan and avoid overcrowding to prevent steaming.

sear.label: Sear
sear.definition: Brown the surface of food over high heat to develop flavor.
sear.tips: Pat ingredients dry and leave undisturbed until a crust forms before flipping.

deglaze.label: Deglaze
deglaze.definition: Add liquid to a hot pan to dissolve browned bits and build a sauce.
deglaze.tips: Remove the pan from heat momentarily to control sizzling, then scrape with a wooden spoon.

braise.label: Braise
braise.definition: Slow-cook ingredients partially submerged in flavorful liquid until tender.
braise.tips: Sear first for flavor and keep the pot covered to trap steam.

roast.label: Roast
roast.definition: Cook food in a dry, hot oven with circulating air for caramelization.
roast.tips: Use a preheated pan and space items apart so edges crisp.

broil.label: Broil
broil.definition: Cook food directly under intense top heat for quick browning.
broil.tips: Keep food 4–6 inches from the element and watch closely to prevent burning.

poach.label: Poach
poach.definition: Gently cook food in barely simmering liquid just below boiling.
poach.tips: Maintain water at 160–180°F to keep delicate items intact.

blanch.label: Blanch
blanch.definition: Briefly boil ingredients, then shock in ice water to set color and texture.
blanch.tips: Salt the boiling water and prepare the ice bath before you start.

simmer.label: Simmer
simmer.definition: Cook food gently in liquid with small, steady bubbles.
simmer.tips: Adjust heat so bubbles lazily break the surface instead of boiling vigorously.

reduce.label: Reduce
reduce.definition: Cook liquid over heat to evaporate water and intensify flavor.
reduce.tips: Use a wide pan for faster evaporation and skim impurities as needed.

emulsify.label: Emulsify
emulsify.definition: Combine fat and water-based liquids into a stable mixture.
emulsify.tips: Whisk constantly while slowly streaming in the fat to keep droplets suspended.

fold.label: Fold
fold.definition: Gently combine light and heavy mixtures without deflating air.
fold.tips: Cut through the center, sweep around the bowl, and rotate until incorporated.

knead.label: Knead
knead.definition: Work dough by hand to develop gluten and structure.
knead.tips: Push the dough away with the heel of your palm, fold it back, and repeat until smooth.

proof.label: Proof
proof.definition: Let yeast dough rest so it ferments and rises before baking.
proof.tips: Cover dough to prevent drying and ferment in a warm, draft-free spot.

temper.label: Temper
temper.definition: Slowly equalize temperatures between ingredients to prevent curdling or shock.
temper.tips: Add a little hot liquid to the cool ingredient while whisking, then return to the pot.

zest.label: Zest
zest.definition: Remove the colored outer peel of citrus for aromatic oils.
zest.tips: Avoid the bitter white pith by using light pressure and rotating the fruit often.

grate.label: Grate
grate.definition: Shred ingredients into fine pieces using a grater or microplane.
grate.tips: Use the right grate size for the ingredient and keep fingers tucked.

caramelize.label: Caramelize
caramelize.definition: Cook sugars until they brown and develop complex flavor.
caramelize.tips: Use moderate heat, stir sparingly, and stop the cooking with a splash of liquid at the desired color.

whip.label: Whip
whip.definition: Beat ingredients rapidly to incorporate air and increase volume.
whip.tips: Chill bowls and beaters for cream or egg whites to speed up whipping.

steam.label: Steam
steam.definition: Cook food with vapor from boiling liquid without direct contact.
steam.tips: Keep water at a steady boil and avoid overcooking by checking doneness early.

smash.label: Smash
smash.definition: Press ingredients firmly to flatten or release juices and flavor.
smash.tips: Use the side of a chef's knife or heavy-bottomed pan to crush items like garlic or cucumbers.
